description: Registra tu música con la API de Last.fm

extendedHelp: Este comando es una amplia integración con la API [Last.fm](https://last.fm) que te permite rastrear tus estadísticas de música.
Inspired by [`.fmbot`](https://github.com/fmbot-discord/fmbot/) with some modified features, you can view information for artists, tracks, albums, users and many more.
Shows your two most recent [Last.fm](https://last.fm) plays.
You can also select a user who's Last.fm profile is linked with me.
subcommands.name: fm
explainedUsage: The Last.fm username of the user who you want me to show this will default to you if you're logged in, if not it'll default to me.

The discord user for me to attempt to resolve a last.fm profile from, this can be their `username`, `@mention`, or their `userId`. If that user has not linked their last.fm profile with me it'll default to you.
subcommands.reminder: This subcommand also supports slash commands! Try out </lastfm fm:{{commandId}}>

extendedHelp: Update your playcount based on your latest [Last.fm](https://last.fm) plays.
You can also reindex parts of you cached playcount by using the following options.
subcommands.name: update
explainedUsage:
The update mode to use, this will determine what I index.
- **Full**: Completely updates your cached last.fm data, basically a combination of all options below.
- **Plays**: Update all of your indexed plays from last.fm, this will not reindex any plays imported through spotify or apple music.
- **Artists**: Update all artists you've listened to and their playcounts.
subcommands.reminder: This subcommand requires you to be logged in with Last.fm.

extendedHelp: Update your playcount based on your latest [Last.fm](https://last.fm) plays.
You can also reindex parts of you cached playcount by using the following options.
subcommands.name: profile

extendedHelp: Update your playcount based on your latest [Last.fm](https://last.fm) plays.
You can also reindex parts of you cached playcount by using the following options.
subcommands.name: pace

fmDescription: Show your two most recent Last.fm plays.
name: lastfm
optionsShowDescription: Whether to show the response of the command.
optionsUserFMDescription: The user to show the plays for, defaults to you if logged in.
updateIndexDescription:
### {{LOADING}} Fetching your Last.fm playcounts...
The following playcount caches are being rebuilt: {{description}}
updateIndexStarted: {{LOADING}} An advanced update has already been started for you! Please wait a few minutes before starting a new one.
updateIndexFrequent: {{LOADING}} You can't do full updates too often. These are only really meant to be used when your Last.fm history has been adjusted.
updateLoading: {{LOADING}} Just a second, fetching your latest scrobbles...
updateNoListeningHistory: {{LOADING}} The Last.fm user {{username, bold}} has no listening history on [their profile](<{{url}}>) yet.
-# • *Just created your Last.fm account? Make sure you set it to [track your music app](<https://www.last.fm/about/trackmymusic>).*
-# • *Using Spotify? You can link that [here](<https://www.last.fm/settings/applications>). This can take a few minutes to start working.*
updateNothingNew: {{LOADING}} Nothing new found on [your Last.fm profile](<{{url}}>) since last check {{previous, duration}}.
updateSuccessNew: {{SUCCESS}} Your cached playcounts have been updated based on {{count, number, bold}} new scrobble.
updateSuccessNew_other: {{SUCCESS}} Your cached playcounts have been updated based on {{count, number, bold}} new scrobbles.
